alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 12 at 4:44PM EST until January 13 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 6 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT... 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 6 PM EST Saturday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline Saturday morning, with 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront would likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 8 ft are possible during the Saturday morning high tide. This would result in beach erosion and minor damage to shoreline structures, as well as wave splashover onto shoreline roads and properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The timing of a wind shift from southeasterly to southwesterly gales in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning will be key to the water level forecast. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/02 AM 5.1/ 5.6 1.7/ 2.2 2.2/ 2.7 1-2 NONE 13/01 PM 6.1/ 6.6 2.7/ 3.2 2.6/ 3.1 0-1 MIN-MOD 14/02 AM 2.2/ 2.7 -1.3/-0.8 -1.1/-0.6 1 NONE 14/02 PM 2.5/ 3.0 -1.0/-0.5 -0.9/-0.4 2 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.8 FT, MODERATE 5.8 FT, MAJOR 6.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.8 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/11 PM 4.5/ 5.0 1.5/ 2.0 2.0/ 2.5 0-1 NONE 13/11 AM 6.2/ 6.8 3.2/ 3.7 3.2/ 3.7 1 MODERATE 14/12 AM 1.7/ 2.2 -1.4/-0.9 -1.0/-0.5 2 NONE 14/12 PM 2.1/ 2.6 -1.0/-0.5 -0.9/-0.4 2 NONE FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/12 AM 9.2/ 9.7 1.9/ 2.3 2.2/ 2.7 1-2 MINOR 13/12 PM 10.0/10.5 2.7/ 3.2 2.3/ 2.8 1-2 MIN-MOD 14/01 AM 6.2/ 6.8 -1.1/-0.6 -0.9/-0.4 3-4 NONE 14/01 PM 7.5/ 8.0 0.2/ 0.7 -0.2/ 0.3 3 NONE &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
